projectsummary.description: Jajuk is a jukebox for all platforms. The goal of this project is to provide a fully-featured application to advanced users with large or scattered music collections. For support, bug request, wishes, visit http://jajuk.info (Project -> Web site)
projectsummary.registration_description:
Jajuk is a music organizer written in Java/Swing. The main goal of this project is to provide a fully-featured application for advances users in order to help them to manage big music collections.
Best features are : - Perspectives / views ui. - Partial or full synchronization between devices. - Unmounted devices management ( CD... ) so unavailable tracks are chown. - Remote devices : P2P music sharing between jajuk nodes.
Please find complete specifications at this url: http://www.florat.net/jajuk-specs.pdf

forum_post.subject: RE: tags online
forum_post.body: Even if only few tags are shown in the CDDB window, all tags will be actually written (I just tested it successfully). Covers are saved are regular files in the audio files directory to make them available from every applications, not as ID3 tag (BTW, all audio formats doesn't support cover tags).

forum_post.subject: tags online
forum_post.body:
i have an album which contains the wrong tags: only the track names are correct, all other information is wrong (album title, artist, genre, year, et). So i click on this album and select 'get tags online'. Jajuk shows me a few matches but when i select them, he only proposes to change the track titles, which are already correct. He doesn't propose to change any of the other tags. What am i doing wrong?
Also, the album cover art which is downloaded, is it embedded in the file or only visible in Jajuk?
thanks, Kris

forum_post.subject: RE: music location is AFP volume on network
forum_post.body: Yes, you're right, i could browse to the network by clicking on the Volumes mount. Thanks.

forum_post.subject: RE: Exporting & importing collections
forum_post.body: The normal way to do it is to use the "Workspace path" location in Preference view / Advanced tab : select a new location and all configuration files will be moved to the new location. If the target directory already contains a jajuk workspace (your case if you already moved configuration manually), jajuk just switches to this new location at next startup.

forum_post.subject: RE: music location is AFP volume on network
forum_post.body: Well, I don't know mush about AFP network drive but I suppose it must be like Windows (CIFS) network drive or NFS ones, isn't it ? in this case, if the drive is mounted, you should be able to browse it from the java file browser when creating a device. If you don't see your drive, it probably mean that the Apple Java virtual machine doesn't support this technology. Check http://developer.apple.com/java/ for more information.

forum_post.subject: music location is AFP volume on network
forum_post.body:
How can i point Jajuk to my music collection on an AFP network volume/share ? It's strange that i can't browse the network in the OS X version and that i couldn't find this in the FAQ.
thanks, Kris

forum_post.subject: Exporting & importing collections
forum_post.body: Hi, i'm bought a new computer, so i want to move the database to the new equip, so, i tried copying the .jajuk folder and it doesn't work, i've been looking in google and found nothing, anyone can help? thx in advance, greentings =)

forum_post.subject: RE: How do I add music to jajuk???
forum_post.body: ahaaaaaaaaaaaaa! THANK you! ;)

forum_post.subject: RE: How do I add music to jajuk???
forum_post.body:
Hi, Go in the Configuration panel, then in the Device view, and finally click on "new". Cheers,

forum_post.subject: RE: Firewall NOD32
forum_post.body:
Hi,
as Bertrand already stated: allow outgoing TCP connections to port 80 for java.exe and/or javaw.exe. I don't know NOD32, but doesn't it show you which executable have been blocked?
Typically you can find your java.exe in C:/Program Files/Java/jre****/bin, but as Java can be installed in any folder, it might also be located somewhere else on your machine.
Let us know if you encounter further problems... bye, sky

forum_post.subject: RE: Firewall NOD32
RE: Firewall NOD32
forum_post.body: The only exe that Jajuk uses is 'java.exe' or 'javaw.exe' in the JRE install path. Perhaps should you allow port 80 to them but in this case, of course, you can't select which java program has access or not to port 80. HIH

forum_post.subject: RE: Firewall NOD32
forum_post.body:
Let's start again.
Of course JaJuk can't do anything about firewalls. Off course NOD32 is a software firewall. And of course I have to configure my firewall to give JaJuk access to port 80. I said this in my original post.
So back to my original question.
Generally one gives port access to the controlling exec file, but presumably because of the way that JaJuk is built, there isn't a Jajuk.exe file in the Jajuk folder.
So what do I have to give access to, because I can't give access to a folder.
There are an awfull lot of NOD32 users out there so I'm just hoping one of them will spot this post, and save me some time by telling me how they fixed this.
BB

forum_post.subject: RE: Firewall NOD32
forum_post.body:
Jajuk cannot do anything about firewalls. If the firewall is hardware, ask your administrator to allow port 80. If your firewall is software (seems to be), parameter it to let jajuk use port 80 using its graphical interface (I can't help you on this, I don't know this program).
If you use a proxy server, parameter it in jajuk in Preference view / Network tab.
Hope It Helps...

forum_post.subject: RE: Firewall NOD32
forum_post.body:
Exactly, I'm trying to see things like - similar artists, lyrics, covers etc, which need internet access, but the firewall is blocking it and there doesn't seem to be anything like an exec file in the JaJuk program folder that I can tell the firewall to open ports for.
BB

forum_post.subject: RE: help wanted . some questions ?
forum_post.body:
Hi,
1- If you want to get OS-used memory, use the Task manager (CTRL-ALT-SUPPR -> show tasks) and check javaws process.If you want to get detailed java heap memory, add -Xloggc:<a file path> in jajuk.bat file next to -Xmx20m
2- You collection is very small. I'll say jajuk should use about 40MB of memory with defaults option.To optimize memory, this link could help: http://wiki.jajuk.info/index.php/Performance_tips
Cheers

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64 bit
forum_post.body: Well got the solution or say workaround, but a question I have. We set JAVA_HOME and PATH environment variables which I believe are being used by Jajuk. If we do have both 32 and 64 bit version what should be values in these variables ?

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64
forum_post.body:
OK the workaround seems to be you need to install a 32-bit Java JRE as well. It will allow you to have a 64-bit and 32-bit versions alongside each other. It will use the 32-bit JRE for 32 bit apps and 64 bit JRE for 64 bit apps.
There is much angst about this on the Java forums...
http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4802695

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64
forum_post.body:
I will look into this but I suspect its something with the way Java 1.6 64 bit edition is loading its DLL's. There is no reason this shouldn't work. This error looks like it is coming from inside the JRE "Can't load IA 32-bit .dll on a AMD 64-bit platform ". I will let you know what I find out.
Melloware

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64
forum_post.body: You can still have a try but I don't see any possible link with this error.

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64 bit
forum_post.body: Well I am able to run lot many other 32 bit applications like games, video and audio softwares even JAVA editors which are 32 bit. Atleast one of the s/w I have installed must have had 32 bit DLLs. so I am also surprized seeing this error. Well may sound a dumb question but would it have to be anything to do with 64 bit JAVA ? Would compiling the sourcecode with 64 bit java help ?

forum_post.subject: RE: Cant get JAjuk to run on Windows Vista 64
forum_post.body:
Strange, I was thinking that 64 bit OSes was able to execute 32 bits libraries... Some users reported Vista 64 bist to work but probably on Intel CPUs.
There're few to be done here. We don't have 64 bits version for the two native libraries we provide under Windows: JIntellitype (hotkeys) and JDIC (tray). The only thing we could do in future releases is to remove features when this OS is detected. This could be done in 1.5. Please follow this ticket: https://trac.jajuk.info/ticket/708

forum_post.subject: RE: MSN's "Show What Im Listening To"
forum_post.body: Technicaly, this could be done using JNI. Ideally, someone could implement a Java API that would hide JNI stuff over it (perhaps someone already did it ?). Please fill a request feature but be aware that it has very few chance to be coded by the current team, except if someone comes with the thing done or an API. We are not JNI experts and anyway we already had so many issues with native librairies that we are now very suspiscious with them. Using JNI brings flaws and internal defects deep inside the java program because it run outside the JVM and non 100% Java programs are pretty difficult to package and to test.

forum_post.subject: RE: MSN's "Show What Im Listening To"
forum_post.body:
Oh and I tried to delve into how Windows Media Player and iTunes send updates to MSN rather than MSN requesting data from them. - Obviously theres a "plugin" but Ive been tring to find how it works and if it could be implememnted easily in Jajuk or any other program: Ive found that the DLL C:\Program Files\MSN Messenger\psmsong.8.1.0178.00.dll is accesed by WMP when the plugin is enabled on the tools menu, the description of that file is "MSN Messenger Status Plugin". So I googled 'psmsong.8.1.0178.00.dll' and found this page: http://forums.microsoft.com/MSDN/ShowPost.aspx?PostID=2069623&SiteID=1 On that page there is some VB code to implement this: -------- Private Declare Function SendMessage Lib "user32" Alias "SendMessageA" (ByVal Hwnd As Long, ByVal wMsg As Long, ByVal wParam As Long, ByVal lParam As Long) As Long
Private Declare Function FindWindow Lib "user32" Alias "FindWindowA" (ByVal lpClassName As String, ByVal lpWindowName As String) As Long
Private Declare Function FindWindowEx Lib "user32" Alias "FindWindowExA" (ByVal hWnd1 As Long, ByVal hWnd2 As Long, ByVal lpsz1 As String, ByVal lpsz2 As String) As Long
Private Type COPYDATASTRUCT dwData As Long cbData As Long lpData As Long End Type
Private Const WM_COPYDATA = &H4A
Private Sub Form_Load()
'The info you want to send goes here Call SetMusicInfo("Artist", "Song Name", "Album") End Sub
Public Sub SetMusicInfo(ByRef r_sArtist As String, ByRef r_sAlbum As String, ByRef r_sTitle As String, Optional ByRef r_sWMContentID As String = vbNullString, Optional ByRef r_sFormat As String = "{0} - {1}", Optional ByRef r_bShow As Boolean = True)
Dim udtData As COPYDATASTRUCT Dim sBuffer As String Dim hMSGRUI As Long
'Total length can not be longer then 256 characters! 'Any longer will simply be ignored by Messenger. sBuffer = "\0Music\0" & Abs(r_bShow) & "\0" & r_sFormat & "\0" & r_sArtist & "\0" & r_sTitle & "\0" & r_sAlbum & "\0" & r_sWMContentID & "\0" & vbNullChar
udtData.dwData = &H547 udtData.lpData = StrPtr(sBuffer) udtData.cbData = LenB(sBuffer)
Do hMSGRUI = FindWindowEx(0&, hMSGRUI, "MsnMsgrUIManager", vbNullString) If (hMSGRUI > 0) Then Call SendMessage(hMSGRUI, WM_COPYDATA, 0, VarPtr(udtData)) End If Loop Until (hMSGRUI = 0)
End Sub ---------
Sooo.. I dont know how many people are working on Jajuk but it doesnt look like its very hard to implement this directly from Jajuk - the functions are all available in user32.dll, the only thing that requires much thought is getting the datatypes right in Java.
It would be great if this could be implemented in 1.4!
Thanks

forum_post.subject: MSN's "Show What Im Listening To"
forum_post.body:
I found Jajuk a few days ago and love it. I dont know how many of you use MSN or use the "Show What Im Listening To" feature, I did with iTunes and I wanted it with Jajuk. I couldnt find any mention of this anywhere so I am making a Messenger Plus Live script myself.
Messenger Plus Live is one of the most popular add-ons for MSN Live Messenger. http://www.msgpluslive.net I have already made a script for Real Player which worked by having a DLL find the RealPlayer Window and extract separatly, the track title and artist from the caption of the window. I simply made a few changes to the DLL and the script so that it worked with Jajuk. This version works perfectly until the user rightclicks the Jajuk system tray icon to create the right-click menu. This is because of the method that the DLL uses to find the window's handle: It finds the window with class "SunAwtFrame", and uses the first one it finds (they are ordered by z-order from top to bottom). When the right-click menu is created, it is another window with class "SunAwtFrame" and it is on top AND it has no caption - this means that the MSN script sees the caption as being "" and thinks Jajuk isnt running. If after using the right-click menu, the user returns the main window to the top of the z-order (by maximising the main Jajuk window and clicking in it), the script functions again without the script being restarted. This is obviously not satisfactory as if you have to maximise the window it defeats the point of having the right-click menu which is making interfacing with Jajuk quick and easy without switching away from your other programs.
Tomorrow, I will get the DLL to cycle through all of the windows of class SunAwtFrame trying to find one with a caption. However, I suspect that any other Java based programs will also create windows of this class.. Can anyone confirm this?? (I dont have any currently on my machine) If this is the case then I will have to rethink the thing entirely.
I have never done any programming using classes of another program but I think ive read somewhere that it can be done (at least with iTunes). So you can actually call methods in iTunes and tell it to pause etc.
Feedback would be good.. it'd be nice if someone actually uses MSN and would appreciate this.
Also, Ive just had another thought; the window caption only shows the track title, not the artist. - I cant find a setting about this anywhere, am I missing it or might this be changed in 1.4?
Hamish

forum_post.subject: RE: Covers: which is the following order ?
forum_post.body: What is better ? ;-) But I will make request to use the one inside the MP3 as first one. Why ? The one inside mp3 has a one-to-one relation and if you reorganize your mp3 files, it follows the mp3. Another advantage of using the "cover" inisde mp3 is that you can have several covers for an album. Let me explain, I have "albums" which consist of live performances of different artists/groups on the same night. (Then I add a picture of the performing artist in their own mp3 recordings.)

forum_post.subject: RE: Ipod and Jajuk
forum_post.body: It depends on what you're looking for. AFAIK (we have no Ipod available for now so please correct me if I'm wrong), Ipod files can be accessed as an USB drive when plugged to a computer, isn't it ? In this case, you can listen music stored on an ipod by creating an USB jajuk device. However, you need a special feature to write files to IPOD in order to be able to see them in the IPOD itself. For that, we plan to integrate open source projects that bring this feature in future release (follow this ticket: https://trac.jajuk.info/ticket/354 ) to allow hard disk / IPod synchronization.

forum_post.subject: RE: Covers: which is the following order ?
forum_post.body:
Currently, Jajuk displays: 1- Default cover (you can set it using the default button in the Cover view, if the cover is online, it is previously downloaded) 2- jajuk-default.* 3- *cover*.* and *front*.* 4- Others local covers 5- Online covers
We don't currently support cover inside MP3.
If you think your scheme better than current one, please create a Request feature, we could study it in future releases.

Hello,
Thanks for making a great piece of software!
I have a couple of requests.
It would be really nice if the order of items in a playlist could be changed by simply dragging and dropping the files within the playlist instead of having to use the Up/Down arrows. My second request is not as important, but would still be nice. I would like an Option to define a default location for the playlist M3U files to be saved so that any time a new playlist is created and saved it will default to that location.
Thank you for your consideration! :-)

forum_post.subject: RE: same album name, different artist
forum_post.body:
Thanks for the feedback
- About the album issue: you can still display tracks by Artist name in the logical tree view so albums will be splited. For jajuk, two albums with the same name are identical (no evol on this in 1.4). You can change the album name as well.
- About the Player perspective: in 1.4, you can add / rmeove any view in any perspective so it will be much more flexible. By default, this perspective displays 1 cover view, 1 another as a tab (we use 2 cover views to diplay at the same time artist picture and album cover), lyrics, animation and as you suggerate a playlist editor view to show the queue.

In the catalog view I can only see them as one album. So three albums look like one.
What can I do ? Waiting for the next version (when is the release) or changing the album names, so that every album name is unique.
Now I'm using jajuk for some month and I'm still satisfied with. Only the animation seems not really usefull in my opinion. What is it for ? Two frames for covers, one for the song .....
Maybe there is place for a playlist editor, so that you can administrate and mix different playlist (e.g. for crossfading).
Thx for your good work ! Sebastian

forum_post.subject: RE: Wikipedia Questions From A Newbie
forum_post.body: Your collection seems quite large and I guess it will be profitable to the community if you could contribute to wikipedia. I think you should try again instead of creating your own wiki. I am a bit surprised you had your page deleted by a Wikipedia admin, maybe the content of the page you created was too poor? Admins usually give the raison in the talk page. Editing wikipedia is not always so easy and requires to respect some rules: create an account, link internally your articles with other pages, give external references, use stubs, use category/sub-category, use template, etc... If any problem, use the talk page, contact wikipedia admins/users. HIH

forum_post.subject: RE: Wikipedia Questions From A Newbie
forum_post.body:
I see a possibilitiy that could be implemented in 1.5 or later if you create a feature request at http://trac.jajuk.info: Allow to add a search type given an url + a request template. For ie: http://my-mediawiki-website/author=$author&album=$album (of course $author would be replaced dynamicaly).
FYI, the URL used in WikipediaView is not stored in XML files but in the code itself.

forum_post.subject: Wikipedia Questions From A Newbie
forum_post.body:
My music collection is unique, in that it is entirely groups who sing a cappella (no instrumental accompaniment). I have 700 a cappella cds and could have a few 1000 (budget permitting). But a cappella is not mainstream and thus only a handful of a cappella groups would be found in Wikipedia. Though there are several "major" touring groups, most are quite obscure in the global music community and several of the groups in my collection are now defunct. Most of the active groups, however, have web sites.
I'm afraid if I try to use the public Wikipedia, to add my artists, many will fail the Wiki notability test and be deleted by the Wiki people.
I'd like to know the experiences of any of you out there who have more obscure (non-mainstream) artists in their collections, who might have needed to make their own Wiki entry for a given artist. Would the notability factor be a concern for me?
If I created my only personal (local) Wikipedia, would I be able to modify the Infoperspective XML file to have it point to the respective artist in my local Wiki? If so, what would be the replacing code for Dockname?
Another idea might be to have the Information Prospective somehow modified, so that the user has a choice (when selecting this prospective) of either going to the artist's Wikipedia page or to the artist's web site. But I reallize most people collect more mainstream music, so this might not be a popular wish. :-)
I'm a newbie to Jajuk and not an experienced programmer. I love how Jajuk is set up, but if I can't get my artist's info included, it would not be useful to me.
Your help would be appreciated. Thanks for humoring me by reading this!
Jim Hamilton, Canada
p.s go to http://www.a-cappella.com to see an online a cappella catalogue and play clips. :-)

forum_post.subject: RE: Empty Jajuk Window on Ubuntu: SOLVED
forum_post.body:
ok, here we are:
HowTo make Jajuk work on Ubuntu Feisty Fawn:
- edit /etc/apt/sources-list: open a terminal an type "sudo nautilus". Enter your password when asked. Nautilus opens in superuser mode. Navigate to /etc/apt and double click on the file "sources.list". A dialog will pop up, click on the second tab there, it says something like "Third Party ..." ("Software von Drittanbietern" in German) and click on the "+ add" button. In the dialog popping up write the following without quotation marks "deb ftp://ftp.debian.org/debian stable main". Click ok and when asked to update the sources on yes/ok
- open a terminal window and type "apt-get install mozilla-browser"
- you will be told that iceape-browser mozilla-browser and some other files need to be installed. Confirm.
- after installation type in the same terminal window: "sudo update-alternatives --config mozilla". Select the number in front of /usr/bin/iceape
After that, Jajuk will work.
Remarks: because of some issues (license) with the name and logo of Mozilla products Mozilla and Firefox are named diferently in Debian based distributions like Ubuntu.
Hope this helps, Morfeus

forum_post.subject: RE: Jajuk does not work with Beryl WM?
forum_post.body:
you can disable the jdic-stuff by not providing a -Djava.library.path=<path-to-jdic-libs>
so here is my startscript (SuSE-10.x) #!/bin/bash # # startscript for jajuk # http://jajuk.sourceforge.net # # Copyright (c) 2006 oc2pus # This file and all modifications and additions to the pristine # package are under the same license as the package itself. # # Please submit bugfixes or comments to oc2pus@arcor.de # # Changelog: # 06.04.2006 initial version # 02.07.2006 added jcommon from jpackage, added swingx from oc2pus # 17.08.2006 added kunststoff from jpackage, liquidlnf from oc2pus # 01.10.2006 using internal kunststoff.jar, changed jakarta-commons-httpclient3 # 16.12.2006 added l2fprod-common from packman, -Xms35M # 16.01.2007 added jcommon, jfreechart from packman
# activate for debugging #set -x
# base settings # installation directory of Jajuk myJajukHome=/usr/share/java/jajuk
echo "" echo "starting jajuk ..."
VERBOSE=1
# source the jpackage helpers . /usr/share/java-utils/java-functions
# set JAVA_* environment variables set_javacmd check_java_env set_jvm_dirs
# set classpath echo "configuring jajuk ..." # these jars are from jajuk myClassPath1=`build-classpath jajuk` # jpackage-packages myClassPath2=`build-classpath \ jakarta-commons-codec \ jakarta-commons-collections \ jakarta-commons-logging \ jakarta-commons-httpclient3 \ jcommon \ log4j` # packman-packages myClassPath3=`build-classpath \ animation \ entagged \ idw \ jcommon jdic jfreechart jl jorbis jspeex \ l2fprod-common laf-plugin liquidlnf looks \ mp3spi \ squareness swingx \ tinylaf tritonus_share \ vorbisspi` # combine all parts to CLASSPATH CLASSPATH=$myClassPath1:$myClassPath2:$myClassPath3
# set jar-entry-class MAIN_CLASS="org.jajuk.Main"
# path for neede shared libraries myNativeLibs=/usr/lib/jdic:/usr/lib myNativeLibs= set_options \ "-Djava.library.path="$myNativeLibs"" \ "-Dawt.toolkit=sun.awt.motif.MToolkit" set_flags \ "-client" \ "-Xms35M -Xmx512M" \ "-XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=20" \ "-XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=30" \ "-Xincgc" \ "-XX:NewRatio=12 # start application echo "starting jajuk application ..." run -notaskbar -notest
so I send a empty $myNativeLibs with beryl and it works :)

forum_post.subject: RE: Software and hardware questions from noob
forum_post.body:
Hi,
This a very interesting question I asked myself some times ago. First, please notice that I didn't set up such an installation myself. We can divide such architecture into following sub-systems: - The controller (remote control, a PDA, a touch screen, jajuk or any other human interface, your phone...): allows controlling your music system -> several elements possible (n people, each one controlling the system to listen different music) - The music storage (a Network Attachement Storage, a directory on an hard disk, a CD, a CD charger...) -> only one repository most of the time (but P2P architectures can appear, we are working on this on jajuk) - The engine (a plain old CD player, a PC, an iPOD...): handle information from the controller (play this track, repeat...) and play music -> Possibility one engine but several instances to manage music for several users - The sound sub-system system (always an amp + always speakers) -> One or more, at least one / different played music - The connectors between the engine and the sound-system (wires: jack, optical..., analogical radio transmitter or digital transmitter (wifi most of the time) ) -> One or more -> Siren Screamer you describe is an analogical radio transmitter -> Apple AirPort is a digital broadcast transmitter system based on wifi (requires iTunes so linux is not supported and cannot handle several programs at the same time) - The display sub-system(jajuk human interface, player LCD...): display information (volume, position, wikipedia data, CDDB data...) on the playing music to user -> One or more
* Jajuk doesn't provide yet any other controller that the human interface (requires a computer + a screen + a keyboard). In the (far?) future, it may support PDA or remote control. See Thundaural Jukebox for an example of jukebox supporting a touch screen. I can't find some other supporting a PDA.
* For the music storage, you will probably encode your music in Ogg or MP3 and use a NAS (see DLink NLU2 for ie)
* The engine cannot be engine neither in your case if you need multiple programs emission (I don't know any suitable solution but as I stated, I'm not aware enough). If we evacuate the controller problem (each user use its computer, not a remote control or a device), a possibility would be to install under Linux an audio application supporting several sound cards (not yet jajuk) and to use either X11 or VNC protocols to display an independent desktop for each user. Then you need two connectors / sound systems for each different program. For ie, it can be two radio emitter, one plugged on each sound card jack output (don't know if it would work due to radio interferences.
Bertrand

forum_post.subject: Software and hardware questions from noob/me
forum_post.body:
Excuse me as I go somewhat wildly OT -- but centering around Jajuk.
1) I think Jajuk is going to provide the excuse for me to finally start the switchover to Linux. <pause for celestial trumpets> I'm looking for advice on setting up a home audio system that would use a server PC running Linux to replace or partially incorporate a plain old stereo setup.
2) I've been looking at cabinets for our old stereo equipment (i.e., no components that are even MP3-, much less Ogg Vorbis-ready) and at cabinets to hold our at least 600 CDs, and realizing it would cost hundreds of dollars to get anything I'd even sort of like to look at -- and be a waste of precious wall space, when instead I might invest said samoleons in a server that could hold the music and also provide space for backups from our other computers: a desktop and notebook, each currently running Windows XP Pro. (I am, BTW, running a wireless network off a Netgear WPN824, featuring "Smart MIMO," though still, as I understand it, under the 802.11g specs, meaning in the 2.4gHz range; network authentication is WPA/PSK, data encryption TKIP.)
3) I don't at the moment plan on using the "server" PC as a true server, although I might move to that in future. I do, however, need it networked wirelessly for those backups. Now, excuse me for jumping on bandwagons, but I'm leaning toward Ubuntu or Kubuntu as the OS on this third box. I'm hoping this can be desktop rather than server flavor, since I don't want to mess with setting up and maintaining a true server (unless there are convincing reasons to).
4) No one else in the house can handle much beyond the demands made on your average Windows user. The kids can just play CDs on their boomboxes in their rooms, but I need a networked system that will allow my wife (a musician, meaning heavy user) and maybe my eight-year-old daughter to just call up what they want to hear. I think this means running the "server" practically 24/7, and a "client" music setup that's pretty easy to use, but configurable by me and, with instruction, by them. Thus, from what I see, I'm going with Jajuk as the player/controller. Now to the questions.
5) First, do I need a separate player at all? I see, for instance, the wireless Siren Screamer <http://www.sirenplayer.com/products/screamer_1.html>, due out in March, I think, that makes it look like I could dispense with the expense of buying a player, if I understand correctly. Or could I do without any such hardware at all, and just wire my speakers straight to the server PC's external audio jacks or sound card?
6) What if I want to allow the family to listen to different music in different rooms, off the same server, wirelessly? Any recommendations regarding hardware or software?
7) Can such a system be set up to incorporate our old stereo tape player and/or a turntable? Do I need my old amp/receiver in any case?
8) I'd also like to get Internet radio, which means stations may force me to read streaming WMA (no RealAudio, I won't have it, WMA is bad enough), though I prefer streaming MP3. This is one of the main reasons I'm thinking of setting up an interface to the server that looks like a thin client (screen, mouse, keyboard), rather than just hooking up a player with the server, since my understanding is that I can't browse Internet radio via a strict (cheap) player.
9) Is all this possible at present, or do I have to wait? Can I hurry now, or must I hesitate?
10) There might as well be ten. What do I have to watch out for? That is, what are the trickiest aspects of setting this up, assuming it can be done?
Many thanks in advance for your advice.
Ed

Thanks again for your feedback. >Basicaly one window to pick songs and one window to see the playlist. Here I'm not sure to understand exactly what you mean but I looks near from what's exist: the queue playlist contains playlist you build and play and the others playlists contains either smart playlists (build automaticaly) or real playlists (m3u files).
About Push before feature, I think I understand what you mean but I'm not sure the complexity it brings worses it (perhaps): when do you want to use a push before ? when creating playlists or when playling a playlist ? doesn't the up/down arrows in playlists editor view makes the trick ? this way, you can push an item (at last position) and then bring it up to first position (a drag 'n drop feature should be better and could be done somedays) ?
About randome playlists, I'm not sure to undertand what you mean with 9 tracks... Do you mean Random smart playlists (in the playlist repository view) or the queue playlist after using global random function (this way, it's all your collection that is shuffle only once and added to queue playlist) ?
Cheers,
Bertrand

forum_post.subject: RE: Push vs play - playlist scheduling use ca
forum_post.body:
I just found that right click menu recently (after working with jajuk for over a year), never thaught to check that. Anyway there are still 2 issues with that: - 2 button clicks (right and left) is still to much for an essential action. - Partially: there is no "push before": force play clears the playlist you just took the time to setup.
The main mission of jajuk is to provide an usefull PC jukebox, this experience could be improved even further I believe.
Here's a scenario I 'd really like to use: Basicaly one window to pick songs and one window to see the playlist.
- One window which shows the playlist with: -- a clear distinction between user selected and system randomly added. This is there now. -- a stable system random selected: now it plays the first one next and randomizes the other 9 to 9 new. It should be stable after randomizing up to 10 following, and allow to remove songs with a single click.
- Another window to select and push after/before songs with: -- a single click to push after/before. The playlist should not be cleared, instead the playlist should have a clear button. -- Besides filtering and sorting (which are there now), I 'd also like a random view (8 songs shown by default) (kinda what is now happening in the playlist window): there it should be possible with one click to push before/after with or without rerandomizing the random view.
Hope it's not to confusing :)

forum_post.subject: RE: Jajuk Sound in version 1.0.2
forum_post.body:
OK, there is 90% chances that it comes from a memory problem (breaks occur when JVM cleanups memory). Please: 1- Upgrade to 1.0.3 (memory settings changed) and tell me 2- Give me your PC memory 3- Confirm that you lanch Jajuk by using jajuk.bat or Windows shortcut. 4- If you still have breaks, please edit your windows shortcut (in menu, select jajuk icon -> properties) and change "-Xms25M" to "-Xms25M -Xloggc:c:\gc.txt" , use jajuk until you have breaks and paste your gc.txt in this forum or send me your file (it is the java memory log).
Thanks.

forum_post.subject: RE: Airport Express Support
forum_post.body:
As I understand this system, you have: - n remote wifi devices plugged on power + jack - your computer (mac only?) with iTunes.
Your computer controls wifi devices using iTunes. For me it seems an hardware propratory solution we can't integrate into Jajuk. However, you have several possibilities to get (almost) the same result with jajuk:
o (my case) : - 1 file server box (linux+samba in my case) - my laptop with jajuk with wifi receptor I create a directory-type device pointing to the share on the other box and I plug my hifi-fi on my laptop so I can use jajuk everywhere in my house with the music repository in a centralized point.
o Use a FM emettor : - 1 box with jajuk and with a FM emettor - n hi-fi FM receptor on the same frequency in your house.

I've been stuck using iTunes simply for this reason... Here is a link w/ info (scroll down):
http://www.nanocrew.net/blog/

forum_post.subject: RE: Adding new external devices (mp3 players)
forum_post.body:
No. As stated in the English documention, all devices exept P2P are actually standard directories, so your player have to be accessed as a mounted storage device, like an external hard disk (a drive letter like e: under windows or /mnt/something under unix). It is the case of most players (I heart that it doesn't work with iPod because you have to use a special soft to access it). Personnaly, as jajuk main developer, I am not interrested into developping some kind of drivers for specific devices but I'm eventally ready to integrate API into jajuk if needed and if it doesn't alter portability.
Bertrand.

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body: Honestly, I'm not a Java thread guru and I think this kind of buffering must be integrated in the BasicPlayer API and JavaLayer from JavaZoom we use (we can change the buffer size that I set to 128KB. By the way, do you have real performance problems ? skips ? Any patch is welcomed and could be integrated in 0.3.2 or 0.4 (0.3.1 is near).

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body:
awt dispatcher thread = event thread? That one is on 5 if I am not mistaken. Idunno if you can actually change it.
In any case: as long as the player and buffer thread are above it, it shoudn't matter how much they are above it: if in a non-blocked state the event thread will yield to the higher priority thread. non-blocked can be: ready (waiting till cpu available) or running (in CPU). in contrast to blocked (FileInputStream.read(), Object.wait(), synchronized, ...)
But I still think it's imported to split up the buffering (loading from disk to memory) and playing (from memory to sound boxes) in 2 differnt threads, with the playing thread being higher and both being higher then the event thread.

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body: This kind of buffering should be included in the BasicPlayer and javaLayer API we use (we can set buffer size). For the moment (0.3.1), I will try to increase dramaticaly the buffer size (from 60Kb to something like 5Mb) and at the same time set the awt dispatcher thread priority from 6 (http://www.wilsonmar.com/1threads.htm) to something like 2 or 3. Player thread is yet 10. Then we will see if some deeper changes are needed.

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body: PS: Just using BufferedInputStream doesn't do the trick: it only reads new data from the hard disk when the buffer is empty and more data is requested. read() still blocks (but not each time).

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body:
Yep, sorry I checked it after making this post :)
Nothing else runs on this priority?
Then it might be a buffering problem (just geussing): Is there a seperate thread that reads the data from the disk into memory, on one priority lower then the player thread?
My ideal model would be: The buffer thread (priority 9) reads from the hard disk (inputstream.read() blocks, memory doesn't) into memory(*). The player thread (priority 10) plays from this memory(*). The buffer thread is one priority lower then the player thread because playing music should never stop.
(*) One might think that memory should be synced. Using Pipe(line)Streams it shouldn't but the property holding the amount in the pipeline shoud be synced.

forum_post.subject: RE: Performance du lecteur MP3 JavaLayer...
forum_post.body:
This is a threading issue I think.
The event thread runs on priority 5 (of max 10). All gui actions run in that event thread on that priority, but the actual player thread should run on a much higher priority (8 or even 10) and be contacted by the others asynchronisly or invokeAndWait. Buffering in that player should. See API Thread.setPriority(), before starting the thread.
If a thread with a higher priority then the current comes out of a blocked state (I/O, sleep, ...) then the current is yielded to the higher one (even in the middle in an operation like long a = 5L;). As long as the higher one doesn't block, the lower one will not run. But... according to O'Reilly's Threads book winblows doesn't respect this principle 100% (very exceptionally).

(with label key like this, it will be very simple to display a random TOTD: just display Messages.getString("tip."+nb of tips*Math.random()))

task.creator: bflorat

history_entry.old_value: [medium] Export data in html or XML

Edition should be done on : full collection, device, directory, style, author and album. I reserve to you this task until 1.2 dev startup (in feb). You will become a new developer and get commit right after having release this feature as a patch.
Notes: - This feature will be available from trees as contextual menu (add the menu item *before* "Properties") - please use FOP/XSLT API to generate reports (formats supported should be at least PDF and HTML) - For API you will use, keep jar size in mind and eventually reduce their size by removing useless classes if more than 300/400 Kb. - If possible, propose several layouts (can be done later). - When validating, user will be prompt to select a directy (default dir: Mes documents under windows, ~ under unix, default file name jajuk-report-<scope>.<extension>) using a JFileChooser.

for HTML format, please add an option to create hyperlinks relative to device path and music files, this way, use will be able to create and publish a web site mapping his collection online (user clicks on the link to launch the file).
[medium] [Reserved] Export data in html or XML
[medium] [Pre-Reserved] Export data in html or XML
[medium] [Reserved] Export data in html or XML

o Look is already pretty good but I wonder if tables presentation should not be better ? The presentation is too squatered and should be much more compact according to me.. The use cases I thought about when creating the task were: 1- Produce a compact document that give the user the opportunity to get a summary of its collection for himself or to be sended to others for future sharing for ie. 2- Produce Web pages with HREF links on files in order to download/play them directly from a personnal web site 3- XML format output could possibly help integration into others programms
o According to me, each item should take only a single line. For ie: foodir - path: /tmp/foodir file1.mp3 (no need for full path to be displayed but make a link on file1.mp3 to http://<full path>/file1.mp3 if link option has been selected, see below) file2.mp3
o Others item data should be displayed in others columns if using a table or displayed like current version but using a collapsable panel (collapsed by default). However, collapse panel is probably complexe and not available for PDF, so table is probably the best option... Note that the table should display custom properties as well (just iterate on item.getProperties, it includes custom properties). On the other hand, the table option has a drawback: can be too large in some cases... I see two complementary solutions: - Add a combo option (say in a new Parameter view tab: "Reporting") allowing user to select table (default) or expended (the actual presentation) + Add a pattern-based option %t - %n ... using same variables convention than already used for rettaging (see Tags tab). One pattern by item ?
o Moreover, isn't be better to replace "directory", "album"... words by icons (available in jajuk dist-files/icons directory) ? + a tooltip on the image to display "directory"... to help a user having forget icon meaning. Note that custom properties name is available using metadata from PropertyMetaInformation class.
o About HTML links, best option could be to create an option (default= false) on Report options tab with: A checkbox "Create HTTP links" + a textfield giving Web prefix for which to create links. For exemple, a user can put some mp3 files in /srv/www/htdocs/music/album/file1.mp3 that can be accessed from http://www.foo.com/dir1/dir2/album/file1.mp3, "music" being the jajuk device. Web prefix should be "http://www.foo.com/dir1/dir2". If the "Create HTTP links" isn't selected, create links to "file://<full file path>" so user will be able to launch local files from his web browser.
o Thanks to add a visible notice somewhere telling to avoid printing the report (I'd like avoiding jajuk being responsable for environmental issues)

history_entry.old_value: Standby for now, waiting for MusicMiner refactoring as a API.

The idea is to allow a user to quickly copy all files related to a playlist into an external devices (like a player or an USB key). User builds a playlist using drag and drop jajuk features, then you save the playlist. On the playlist (in tree or playlist repository), you have a new "prepare party" feature that takes the output directory (using a file choser, use JajukFileChooser and filters). Then copy (see examples in the synchronization code in Device class) the files + a new playlist file (.m3u) in a flat directory (child of selected directory and with the date/HHMM in the name to differentiate multiple party preparations / extractions).
